author: Dorothy Williams
title: Grilled Coho Salmon With Poblano Pesto
ingredients: 4 poblano chili peppers, peeled with seeds removed
¾ cup Parmesan cheese, freshly grated
4 poblano chili peppers, peeled with seeds removed
¾ cup Parmesan cheese, freshly grated

instructions_list: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Roast poblano chili peppers for 15 minutes, then let them cool slightly.

Add the peppers to a food processor and pulse. We want them coarsely chopped. Add garlic, cilantro, lime juice, and salt. Pulse mixture until smooth. Add walnuts and process to finely chop them. Drizzle olive oil slowly while pulsing. Add Parmesan cheese and lightly pulse to mix them into the pesto sauce. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Coat coho salmon with ancho chili rub. Grill over medium heat, skin side down, for about 3 minutes. Flip the salmon and grill for another 2 minutes. Transfer carefully to a separate plate.
Divide coho salmon into 4 pieces and serve with pesto sauce on top. Serve alongside your favorite carbs and veggies for a complete meal! Enjoy!
description: Indulge in this excellent ancho-crusted Grilled Coho Salmon with Poblano Pesto that's sure to become a crowd-favorite!
